content: hi all. We customarily have connectathon channels in skype. It would make most sense to move them here from now on - should we just do them in the implementers stream, or add a new connectathon stream?
I vote for the main channel ( see how little traffic workflow is getting)
The implementers channel is already noisy enough... Definitely these should be in their own stream(s)

I would agree a separate stream. The conversation won't be of general implementer interest. (Workflow is a design space, not an implementer space, so it's no real surprise the chat is as quiet as the list.)

The main channel is noisy and that attracts who might not normally see the connectathon tracks. I think this could garner more interest and exposure to the connectathons. which I believe is a good thing. Maybe I'm not typical but I browse all the implementor streams.
some of the connectathon streams already have an appropriate channel - cds-hooks, workflow, cda to fhir, argonaut (for DAF), ontology, v2 to FHIR
so all those connectathons streams should be a topic there.
others should be a topic in implementers, and if the volume proves a problem, we can change course
